revised_title: Tide Observations at Tahiti: Analyzing Tide Data and Methods
tldr: Captain Edward Belcher's paper presents tide observations conducted at Tahiti, detailing the construction of the tide gauge, methods of observation, and precautions taken to ensure accuracy. The study reveals that there are two distinct tidal periods per day, and that high tides do not always occur at noon. The findings challenge previous assertions by explorers like Kotzebue and Beechey.
